vision.notes: Given the deep-sea habitat (1000-5000m), vision may be reduced or specialized for low-light conditions, but there is no direct information on this within the provided text.

chemoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting prey (crabs) and mates in the deep sea. Inferred as being crucial for prey detection in deep-sea environments.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely present and important for detecting water currents and vibrations to locate prey and avoid predators in the deep sea.

electroreception.notes: No information available regarding electroreception in this family.
